Reviews.Content: gorgeous view       Piazza S. Maria Novella - under construction
Reviews.Author: travelingcnm

Reviews.Content: Fantastic Firenze hotel Brilliant hotel, will definately return. Big clean luxurious rooms and a swimming pool with views which will be remembered forever. Fantastic worth every penny!
Reviews.Author: Timems

Reviews.Content: The Minerva is GRAND Sought a central, well maintained hotel with a swimming pool and convenient to public transport. Had all of this in the G H Minerva. Excellent condition and very helpful staff. It would help if they could provide a stairlift for access from the 5th floor to the pool floor for those with some mobility problems.The Moroccan barman at the Pool Bar made one feel they were in their local bar.The room was on the small side of adequate but we only needed it for sleeping and preparing for the next outing.
Reviews.Author: Sixtyplustravellers

Reviews.Content: Bella Minerva!!!       View of the piazza and Santa Maria Novella from the roof terrace.
Reviews.Author: ljo78

Reviews.Content: Lovely hotel in a great location This was our second visit to this hotel. The hotel is in an excellent location, both convenient yet peaceful. It is well-placed for some interesting restaurants  shopping. The roof-top pool is a peaceful haven in this busy city, with wonderful views.We stayed in a Junior Suite overlooking the facade  cloisters of the Santa Maria Novella church. This was very specious with a seperate sitting area  a long but narrow balcony, again with wonderful views. Nice details for us like complimentary mineral water, tea/coffee/biscuits, robes etc. Not sure if you get these in all rooms.The staff at this hotel are exceptional. This is spearheaded by Mr Stefano Fussaro (sp?, sorry), the front office manager. Nothing is too much trouuble. When we arrived (hot  bothered from the journey) I was concerned that the A/C in our room was not strong enough. Stefano offered us 3 different options to resolve this, personally showing us around to other rooms. After discussion, we decided to stay in the original room which was one of the nicest Junior Suites in the hotel. Stefano assured me that the A/C would be adequate  it was (the A/C had been turned off for some days for the previous guest  the room needed to cool down). The reason I am relating this story is to illustrate the trouble they will take to ensure you are perfectly happy, at a time when the hotel was very busy too.The duty managers in the Breakfast room are the same, charming  wanting to ensure everything is right for you. Breakfast offers a wide range of options, too much to mention here. There is also champagne available each morning  every day we indulged in a glass to celebrate our holiday.Although we arrived quite early in the day, our room was ready for us which I much appreciated.The Grand Hotel Minerva has been our regular haunt in Florence  I see no reason to change. A very well deserved 5 stars for this lovely hotel  its charming  helpful staff.
Reviews.Author: tabbykins

Reviews.Content: A bit of luxury-Fabulous hotel       our clean and spacious room 320
Reviews.Author: maureen1977

Reviews.Content: Highly Recommended Absolutely fantastic hotel, highly recommended. You couldn't ask for a better city hotel. Hotel, service, location exceeded my expectations. Rooms were clean, spacious and what you would expect from a 5* hotel. Roof pool was beautiful with fantastic views, definitely a selling point! Only 5 minutes walk from the station and city centre! Staff very welcoming. What more can I say.....book, book, book!
Reviews.Author: lausid

Reviews.Content: Great Location This hotel is well located not far from the train and bus station aand a short walk to the centre and all the museums, restaurants and beautiful piazzas. We booked through expedia and were unable to upgrade the room but I am glad we didn't as the room had everything we wanted and was extremely comfortable and very clean. The only thing that was slightly negative was the lack of storage, we were there for 10 nights and there wasn't enough room for our clothes.Breakfast is plentiful and served until 10:30am and they are still refreshing the food at 10:10 rather than letting it completely run down. If I was to critisise anything it would be the lack of gym and the service at the bar at the pool as it is erratic at best. It can take 20 mins to get served and another 20 to get your drink!All in all, if you haven't paid the rack rate you have a bargain.
Reviews.Author: Bedfordblue

Reviews.Content: wonderful Wonderfull hotel, good location near the station.Very clean and very friendly staff. The breakfeast is great.Lovely swimmingpool with nice chairs.The rooms are very nice with beatiful vieuws.
Reviews.Author: bogaerts

Reviews.Content: Grent central hotel Spent a long weekend here in June and could not fault anything about this hotel. The rooms were spacious and very clean.There was plenty of choice for breakfast each morning. Didn't use main restaurant.This hotel is very central to everything you need to visit in Florence. In front of the hotel there is a lot of building work going on so the piazza was in fact a bit of a building site and not somewhere where you could sit and relax as reflected by photos on Tripadvisor at present. I'm sure all the work will be completed by next year. This did not in any way spoil the enjoyment of our holiday.
Reviews.Author: carrolld

Reviews.Content: Great hotel in a great location Just on a whim picked this hotel and it was great. tho we had a deluxe room - with no view (watch out for this...) the upside was that it was dark for sleeping and quiet. not planning on spending much time in the room, i didn't bother making noise about it. The room was very comfortable - and quite nice sized. we did not eat b'fast there as it was 30E--$$$.loved being right near the pantheon and the square in front of it. i had my food allergic child with me and there is a nice grocery right off the square which was very handy for us.the a/c worked great in the hotel -- the staff was very helpful. roof bar quite $$ - 9E for a soda...but lovely.for a/p car service used bob's limo and it was great and much less than the hotel offered rate. had trouble recharging some electronics and concierge came up w/his personal transformer which finally got things going.but a lovely lobby to sit in-truly grand-and a very nice place to stay. almost stayed near the spanish steps and was very happy to not have put ourselves in the midst of the fray. this hotel is about a 10min. walk to the steps and also near to the trevi fountain, piazza navona, etc, etc. a great location in other words. i felt after agonizing w/too much info, i picked just the right spot.
Reviews.Author: citymom

Reviews.Content: Great location - wonderful food We stayed here in May for two nights as part of our Italian tour. The Hotel has a brilliant location with memorable views from the rooftop terrace with pool, was clean and comfortable with helpful, friendly staff but the jewel in the crown is the restaurant - I Choistri. We had the tasting menu which was delicious - 4 courses with 8 different taster dishes including a different wine with each course - 50 euros each - brilliant value! Other dishes being served all looked wonderful to and we wished we were staying longer. Don't bother tramping round Florence to find a decent restaurant - just go here! The renovations to the square at the front still weren't complete but were not intrusive in any way so don't be put off.
Reviews.Author: isabelCornwall

Reviews.Content: We loved it here1! WE loved it here. After reading some of the reviews, we were a little curious how it would be.. the minute we walked in it was great. The staff were all lovely and helpful. My mother in law had the wrong luggage from Pisa and the front desk staff, helped her work through it for over an hour! All were gracious and wonderful. The room was very nice for the 3 of us. Modern, updated with a bar and electric water kettle for tea or coffee. The breakfast options in the restaurant were delicious. After Firenze, we went to Pisa and our Hotel there could not compete... Minerva was hands down better in all aspects.The location is an easy walk to all.Best part... the roof pool, bar and view. This is where we spent a lot of time, and was the best part of Italy for our 6 1/2 year old, who loved it. The view was amazing, gorgeous, and daily made me pinch my self that we were here.Worst part...... construction zone. They are restoring the piazza in front, should be done in October. Close your windows tight in the am... weekends are better at Minerva until construction is over. But this is not a deal breaker. All the other positives still make this a fantastic hotel in many ways.
Reviews.Author: calinyfolks

Reviews.Content: great hotel for seniors exellent hotel, helpfull staff, roof swimming pool, nice breakfast, exellent location, quiet rooms, most guests are over 50 years, so i don't recommend it to youngsters; 1 minus: bathroom and especially the showers are too small if u r over 1.50 meters long
Reviews.Author: dabelgium

Reviews.Content: So Florence, so fantastic... The facility is immaculate, and the location perfect. BUT more than anything, each and every staff member was so warm and helpful and professional in a way that distinguishes this hotel from others with the same rating. Looking out the window at Alberti's facade of Santa Maria Novella is also not bad....
Reviews.Author: FG1Nyc

Reviews.Content: Would stay here again This was my first trip in Florence and I couldn't have picked a better place to stay. My daughter and I had a wonderful experience. The hotel was very conveiently located and we were very happy with being able to walk in Florence and its many major attactions.The staff is efficient and very pleasant at all times, providing directions, recommendations, and even calling a couple of special museums for information. We booked a standard room with a long stay offer and we upgrade to a superior room: very spacious and clean, large bathroom with bathtub, the towels were thick and fluffy, and fresh ones were provided each day, teacoffee maker on the writing desk.Thank you to the Grand Hotel Minerva for a great stay in Florence!
Reviews.Author: Anne66Germany

Reviews.Content: Keep to the back The staff were friendly. We were in a room over the front door.In the early morning we were awoken by loud vibrations and rumbling noises - really penetrating the room. They came from the front of the hotel where staff were moving luggage onto coaches. The new paving outside the hotel is corrugated and thus combined with the wheels on the bottom of cases and trunks on their way to coach or cab - a distance of about 10 yards/metres - to create a lot of noise. When we mentioned it to a member of the reception staff, his reaction though apologetic, suggested that we were by no means the first to notice the problem.So unless you get up very early, vote for the bedrooms at the back!CW
Reviews.Author: chasw11

Reviews.Content: ideal place in Florence I spent a week at this hotel with my family and had a very nice stay. everything was perfect! The superior room was spacious and confortable. All amenities were in the hotel and the service was great, above all int the hotel restaurant where we had a good meal.Breakfast good with a wide range of choice.Location was perfect, very close to the city center.
Reviews.Author: TheBestNewZealand

Reviews.Content: Really Wanted to Love this Hotel! Traveled to Italy in dead heat of summer and tourism with teen son and daughter and used a Travel Agent to book part of our trip. Florence was our second stop and we were really disapointed by this hotel--think it tained our feelings of Florence. We really wanted to love this hotel--the location in Florence was good and close to the train station and the Duomo. The staff was the BEST we encountered in Italy and went out of their way to help and please us. The food was terrffic, although we were twice one of the only people in the restaurants. (Breakfast was busier.) However, I am perplexed reading the reviews--did NO ONE else notice that the entire plaza in front of the hotel was torn up with construction going on (or NOT as in our case?) Not even the natives knew when it would be done nor the rennovation on the lovely adjacent church shroud in cheese cloth (or so it appeared. )What a downer. But the rooms weren't any better--the A/C was weak, they were very traffic worn and clearly needed some fresh paint, new carpets and updating. We were in a large room that did have a lovely HUGE bathroom that was great, but the closet--although also huge had a burned out light that was never fixed and the pants presser didn't work. (No irons in Italy--bummer!) The kids couldn't wait to hit the roof-top pool, but blink and you'll miss it. There was no room for them and the other guests pretty much monopolized it--and the lounge chairs. However, the tiered roof-top area was lovely with a bar and very nice appe's! We very much enjoyed the complimentary party one night and the singer and her band was EXCELLENT--wish she had a CD! What a treat (for hubby and I at least!) Maid service was slow and although I left a daily tip--which is not expected from what I had heard, our meager requests were not met (new light bulb--extra towels--minor stuff.) Next time, I would stay more central Florence and try to avoid any constrution--which would be difficult: we counted EIGHTEEN from the rooftop!! Again, we really did want to love this place and the staff and management was the BEST!! Sorry guys!
Reviews.Author: PetLoverMom

Reviews.Content: Loved the hotel...hated the guests Just like the title says....Loved the hotel...hated the guests Firstly the hotel was just wonderful...clean very spacious and far better than most 4 star Italian hotels. I would recommend it to any one staying in Florence.Now for the appalling behaviour of some of the guests. Let me start with the loud mouthed Americans who arrived on mass and just took over the pool area, yelled and screamed at the top of their voices (i think they were just talking) so everyone had to hear their conversations whether you liked it or not. And their spoilt kids who consistently dive bombed into the pool regardless of any one else....what a bunch of losers....no wonder so many people dislike them! Now for the tight wad Japanese tour group who raided the breakfast room every morning and proceeded to not only stuff them selves with as much food as possible but also...get this...stuff their hand bags and shopping bags with extra food for later on!Best of all was the 3 japanese ladies who bought their extra breakfast food up to the pool terrace every evening and proceeded to eat dry bread, cheese, yogurt, fruit and cereal for dinner!Oh my God.....they were like a bunch of locusts!By the time we got to the breakfast room we were lucky to find some scraps that some how escaped the Japanese raiders.Shame that the hotel management did nothing to stop this type of behaviour...it seemed that they were aware but chose to do nothing about it
Reviews.Author: josko98

Reviews.Content: Very comfortable hotel in a good location       view from the roof 3
Reviews.Author: TonyBoo

Reviews.Content: Traveler Beware! The neighbohood is shabby. The hotel is old. The square on which the hotel is located is dirty and noisy. I did not feel safe. The website shows lovely rooms - in reality not as good as shown. We had a Superior Room - price was almost $400.00 American dollars per night. Your shower is a pull out folding wall that you have to assemble before turning on the water - no bath. The drain for the shower is actually in the center of your bathroom floor. I booked a room on line and then was told when we arrived for check in that the room I booked would not be large enough for two people and they had to move us into a larger more expensive room - this should have alerted me from the start! Not that you want to be watching TV when in Italy, however, there is down time in the evenings but we found that the Pay-for-View did not work in our room. The hotel valet parked our car and mysteriously we received three traffic violations from the Florence police four months later with fines for each ticket of $92.00 euro dollars. The dates and times for the violations were when the hotel valet had possession of our rental car. On top of this, the rental car agency AutoEuropa around the corner of the hotel charged $50.00 euro dollars per ticket to our American Express stating it was a processing fee to give information to the Florence police of where to contact us in the US. There's a scam going on there, and I am in the midst of trying to fight the tickets. It is a nightmere as they keep coming in the mail from Italy - all with dates and times when the hotel valet had our rental car. My advice is not to stay at this hotel and don't rent a car in Italy!
Reviews.Author: Tourist28

Reviews.Content: Wait until the Renovation of the Piazza is Done!!! The junior suite we had was overall pretty comfortable with a nice view. The room was furnished with sort of flea market furniture, butthe bed was comfortable and the linens were very nice. Towels were small and thin, though and the toiletries were of mediocre quality. The public rooms of the hotel are quite nice and the breakfast was first-rate. However, here's the big problem with the Minerva right now....the large Piazza it's located on is undergoing a huge renovation and it is a mess, with noisy equipment banging around all day long. It looks to me like it's going to be fairly extended project, so I'd ask about the status before I ever booked again.
Reviews.Author: PDXpopcorn

Reviews.Content: Love the hotel I would like to say that this hotel is the best!!! We had a wonderful time. Our 1 bedroom suite #420 was wonderful. It was huge, had two full baths and one had a huge tub with whirlpool. We stayed two nights and then went to Siena for 1 night and returned back for 3 nights. I was so afraid they were going to give my suite to someone else.But they did a hold on our luggage since we only needed a small overnight bag for Siena and kept the suite for us until our return the next day. More than I expected from them!!! The view from the pool was great, The buffet breakfast was wonderful everything you can think of. Of all the hotels in Italy their breakfast was the best. They are working on the plaza in front so I didn't see what other guests had described in other reviews but at night a few people came out to just hang around and I think those are the people they were talking about. Do be honest they didn't bother me at all, Never even looked at you!!! Oh by the way the internet is free and they have two computers for you to use. I can't say enough about the people working behind the front desk they were so nice and helpful. Be sure and check out my other reviews at Hotel Metropole in Venice, Rembrandt in London and the Grand Continental in Siena. If you want to ask me anything feel free to e-mail me at donatravel@aol.com
Reviews.Author: donatravel

Reviews.Content: Thank you Hotel Grand Minerva! I can't say enough about this hotel 鈥?We were married on September 28, 2007 in Ravello Italy. We had all our travel arrangements made six months ahead of time with the help of a travel agent. We spent 7 nights in Positano - then we were suppose to start our honeymoon with five nights in Florence and go on for four nights in Venice. We had such an amazing time on the Amalfi Coast and we were very eager to have the same experience in Florence. We arrived at our scheduled hotel 鈥淗otel Mona Lisa鈥?(Please read our review of this hotel for details) we absolutely could not stay at this hotel 鈥?it was late and we couldn鈥檛 reach our travel agent to make other arrangements for us. My husband and I made several phone calls via our cell phone we brought with us 鈥?because the Mona Lisa hotel phone didn鈥檛 work and they were un-willing to fix it for us. To our surprise every hotel we called was totally booked and could not accommodate us for four full nights. I was beginning to think our honeymoon was going to fall apart. At one point we even considered canceling the rest of our tip and heading back to Positano where we had a fabulous time.My husband reached The Grand Hotel Minerva 鈥?They said they were also booked for the full four nights. Out of desperation my husband explained our situation 鈥?that we were on our Honeymoon 鈥?about the really bad experience at Mona Lisa 鈥?He asked if they had any other suggestions for us. To our surprise the front desk person told us to come right over and he could try to help us. (He even sent a taxi to pick us up) The taxi driver who spoke very little English and wasn鈥檛 connected to the Grand Minerva Hotel - Kept shaking his head at Hotel Mona Lisa. He Kept saying to us 鈥渧ery bad, very bad鈥?as he pointed to the hotel!When we arrived at The Grand Hotel Minerva we were given a choice of three different rooms one was more beautiful than the other. Without the front desk saying anything about the other hotel 鈥?We could tell by the looks on there face that they knew all about the bad reputation of that hotel. I even think they felt sorry for us. An offered us our choice of rooms. Every room was extremely large and just incredibly decorated and exceptionally clean. The location was perfectly central to everything. The staff was so helpful they set up excursions every day for us and spent so much time making sure we had all the information that we needed. Never once did we feel that we were a bother. And we did take a lot of there time! This hotel really made our trip to Florence wonderful. Although it was a bit chilly at night we went to the roof where the pool was 鈥?Of course the pool was closed but the view of the city was spectacular.
Reviews.Author: jaycam

Reviews.Content: Great location, unfriendly receptionists       our tiny room
Reviews.Author: Mista-go

Reviews.Content: All around good For our summer holidays i spent 3 nights at the Grand Hotel Minerva in Florence. The hotel location is very great if you arrive in Florence by train: the main railway station is a few minutes from the hotel! Also, you can easily walk to all the best parts of Florence. Our double room was bright, spacious (unusually for a European hotel) and clean with very nice bathroom. We found the piazza in front of the hotel very safe and not all intimidating, so don't worry. We could not have been happier and would definitely return.
Reviews.Author: luanapozzetti

Reviews.Content: OK but nothing grand Previous reviewers have talked about the Piazza being under construction and it is. That wasn't much of a bother for us as something in Italy is always under construction. The room was OK but it looked tired. I think the hotel needs an overhaul. We didn't spend much time in the hotel so it served it's purpose. The view from the roof top pool was awesome. I even took a dip in the cold water. The pool is not heated but ti was refreshing. If I go to Florence again I'll book another hotel.
Reviews.Author: FrqTravlr

Reviews.Content: Great location - will be even better when the construction is finished We stayed in this hotel for four nights at the end of September. The construction work being done on the piazza in front of the hotel and the church was no surprise and looked like it would be going on for a while longer. This did not affect our enjoyment of the stay as you could not hear any noise from the work, plus the hotel is located very centrally - 2 minutes walk from the station, but more importantly 5-10 minutes from the Duomo and 10 minutes from the Ponte Vecchio and Uffizi. The standard of the hotel is what I'd expect from a four star - not more or less, although the bar service by the pool was a little sporadic. There is a telephone up there to get service if there is noone around. The pool is a real asset - with amazing views over Florence and also a good place to chill day or night.Our room was larger than average I think (room 209, nicely tucked away at the end of a corridor) and the cleanliness was fine (although we did have to chase them one day as our room was not cleaned by 4pm - cleaners then came straight away).Overall I would recommend the hotel if you are coming to Florence.
Reviews.Author: catdav

Reviews.Content: stayed in a construction zone while preparing for our August trip to Italy in April, i noticed in one of the tripadvisor reviews that there was extensive construction being done in the piazza outside the hotel. my travel agent called the hotel to inquire and was assured construction would be completed by July so as not to be a problem for our August visit.Be advised that the construction is in fact ongoing and inquiries i made to the hotel staff indicate it will be so for at least the next year. very unpleasant to look at.having stated the above let me also state that we were traveling with our 2 thirteen year old granddaughters and stayed in room 132 which is a 2 bedroom suite with 2 baths that was perfect for our requirements. We also enjoyed the roof pool at the end of a very hot day.
Reviews.Author: icknax

Reviews.Content: Nice Hotel, Roof Top Pool Deck added bonus during Summer Stayed for 3 nights in mid June. Excellent spacious room. Roof top pool deck was a great bonus given the stunning weather. Breakfast buffet is good and free internet access in the lobby proved helpful. Piazza is a bit untidy looking at present given the renovation of it and the church but to be honest never impacted on our stay. Locals that congregate there also never caused an issue. Location is perfect - both in terms of the train station (very short walk) and for exploring central Florence (we walked everywhere). Overall I would not hesitate in recommending this hotel.
Reviews.Author: 3215jmt

Reviews.Content: Unprofessional............... Unfortunately I didn't have the pleasure of staying in this hotel as on arrival I was told that they had decided to cancel my reservation.I had booked online and was had my documentation which stated that myreservation was guaranteed but this was to no avail.I had made my booking four months in advance on a credit card that expired just before my stay. The management of the hotel have a policy of checking each credit card the day before arrival. If it fails than reservation is cancelled. They should not claim that a reservation is guaranteed.We were offered another hotel further from the centre. They actually thought they were doing me a favour. The whole fiasco was extremely frustrating and embarrassing. My advice is to give it a miss and stay somewhere run by professionals.
Reviews.Author: Hotfuzzy

Reviews.Content: Just OK - We won't return First of all, the piazza is a mess. The church is being renovated and is completely covered up. There are scaffolds and cranes throughout the area. Worse than the construction mess though is that each night the piazza attracts a strange element of people that lay around the grass and drink, smoke, bang on objects to make music?, scream, sing... In the morning, the litter is everywhere. One night, a man climbed one of the cranes and screamed for hours, apparently threatening to jump. Police and fire trucks arrived and eventually the man came down. It's a not a high-class crowd. It can be a bit uncomfortable coming in late at night and having to pass through the crowd outside the hotel. The room itself was OK. We were on the 5th floor in a standard room with a double bed. The room was clean and had a window looking out onto the piazza (not necessarily a good thing). Breakfast served each morning was nice. Don't expect warm or friendly service from reception or concierge. They don't seem very animated or interested in providing a high level of service. The hotel is located in close proximity to all you'll want to do, but so are dozens of other hotels. Try the Savoy for example. Beautiful piazza (Republica) surrounded by cafes and a superior central location.
Reviews.Author: MichelleC06

Reviews.Content: Wonderful Florence Hotel       View of the Piazza from room
Reviews.Author: Transplanter

Reviews.Content: simply the best 2nd April 2007 arrived at florence rail/coach interchange to follow instructed route to Minerva hotel and found the same not five minutes walk away. As descibed, perfectly situated for all the sights set in a very picturesque location. We upgraded our room in order to enjoy the view and the atmosphere of this wonderful city. The room was spotlessly clean , light and airy. The staff, very attentive especially in the restaurant which served a very tastful breakfast.The overall ambience of this hotel could only be described as wonderfull and having took some time to visit other hotels within the city centre with a view of comparison, we were more than satisfied of our choice and will definatley return to the grand hotel minerva Florence.
Reviews.Author: johnnyalan

Reviews.Content: Would definately recommend Was a walk-in; having to cancel my other hotel reservation. Staff was very professional and quoted me a decent price for a quad. Saved my vacation. Staff was also helpful regarding sightseeing. Great breakfast. If you decide to stay get directions - not very easy to get to unless you know Florence.
Reviews.Author: biya1218

Reviews.Content: Adequate...at best Our stay at the Hotel Grand Minerva was just adequate - It was quite warm in Florence, and the registration personnel informed me (after I noticed my room was not cooling off - it was close to 80 degrees farenheit in the room) that they had not switched from heat to air conditioning. They did, however, offer another (smaller) room in a different wing of the hotel. The rooftop pool was drained - I did not see a bar.Upon returning to the hotel after a day of sightseeing, I discovered some rather large cleaning rags on my toiletries, apparently left by the cleaning staff.On a good note, the breakfast was yummy - eggs, pastries, fruit. Upon returning to the hotel after a day of sightseeing, I discovered some rather large cleaning rags on my toiletries, apparently left by the cleaning staff.
Reviews.Author: Anonymous40

Reviews.Content: Outstanding stay! Service, location, staff! Excellent restaurant. This was the third visit for us! The Minerva can only be described using superlatives. The location, the service, the staff is the best. The restaurant on the ground floor is one of the best in Florence, which makes breakfast a true treat. This Grand Hotel' is just that...GRAND.It is located just outside the Old City and is perfectly located to reach the main sights (by walking) and is only 1/4 mile from the railway station and the hub for all of the buses you could possibly need. The only problem....difficult to get a reservation!
Reviews.Author: aggpe

Reviews.Content: Grand Minerva - outstanding service We are thinking of another trip to Italy and one of the first things that comes to mind is where we will stay. The Hotel Grand Minerva in Florence was one of the best memories we have of our travels.The staff is excellent, the hotel spotlessly clean, the decor outstanding, The location is the best you can get, especially if you are traveling by train. The area is safe to walk even late at night and the views are spectacular. We highly recommend this fine hotel to you if you are fortunate enough to be going to Florence for a vacation. No matter where you want to go in Florence walking there is a pleasure from the Grand Minerva.And--don't forget to be eating a gelato when you are walking!
Reviews.Author: macstraits

Reviews.Content: Lovely hotel - great location Terrific 4-night experience staying at this hotel. It is lovely. In an historic city it manages to blend modern decor with the historic. Our room was terrific - looking out at Santa Maria Novella (though the facade of the building was covered for renovation!!) Room amenities were excellent and the room has a safe. What I really loved about the hotel is the view from the rooftop(s). There's a beautiful setting area adjacent to the rooftop pool, a rooftop bar and several hidden pocket verandas. Close to the train station as well as some wonderful restaurants and great walking. Also a very well-done breakfast and lovely room. The front desk staff was somewhat uneven in service, but overall they were fine. Loved it and will stay there again.
Reviews.Author: SueDunBos

Reviews.Content: Great 30th Birthday From David Taylor, Northumberland, UK.My wife and I booked a 4 night stay in the Minerva from 21-25 March 2007 inc. as a surprise 30th birthday present for our daughter chosing the Minerva because of location, 4 stars and its restaraunt. We were not disappointed being offered adjoining no smoking rooms as requested with a view of Piazza Santa Maria Novella. High standards of cleanliness in all areas, very helpful and friendly staff from reception to housekeeping and an excellent restaraunt (try the set Tuscan menu with complimentary wines at each course - great value and superb food). The hotel is light and airy and very comfortable with a great breakfst to start the day. The Duomo is less than a 10 minute stroll as is the Ponte Vechio and other major attractions. Tip - visit the Duomo around 4pm to avoid very long queues! The adjacent Santa Maria Novella Church was enshrouded in scaffolding for renovation of the marble facade and there was other building work at the opposite side of the piazza but we were made aware of this when phoning the hotel prior to booking and it in no way detracted from the holiday. The Piazza tends to be a meeting place for the younger set until late evening but we encountered no problem behaviour. The roof top terrace views are stunning across the city and towards the Tuscan countryside and I am sure the pool will be very popular in the warmer weather which was unseasonally cold for the end of March.Can unreservedly recommend!
Reviews.Author: daveandmarley

Reviews.Content: LOVED IT!!!! I was treated as royalty the entire 9 days I stayed at this marvelous hotel, by the ENTIRE staff. I would recommend this hotel to absolutely anyone needing or wishing to stay in Florence. I have traveled the world, being an 'Army Brat' most of my young life, and now as an adult having paid for and spent many hard-earned vacations in not up-to-par accomodations, this hotel exceeded anything I have ever experienced!
Reviews.Author: maxwelldee

Reviews.Content: Great home base in Florence When we wanted a centrally located hotel in Florence when visiting our grandson for a weekend, our travel agent sent us to the Grand Minerva. It proved an ideal location with the Duomo a short walk across the Piazza and along the street and our grandson's Florence School of Design around the corner from that famous cathedral. It was a magical time and the Minerva was a classy home base with great food and a fabulous view from our window. The concierge got us tickets for viewing the museums of interest, like the Uffizi, and thus we avoided line-ups when viewing the spectacular art. I finally got to see the original of Birth of Venus! The hotel is not inexpensive but it represents excellent value given the quality of accommodation, food and service, plus its incomparable location.
Reviews.Author: HappytrailsToronto

Reviews.Content: Loved!! Very good surprise. Out room was very big and new. 2 TVs, great bathroom, delicious breakfast, everyting was great!!
Reviews.Author: FB77

Reviews.Content: Good deal in Florence I would like to suggest to the Trip Advisor members a great deal in Florence: the Grand hOtel Minerva! It's a beautiful 4 star superior hotel with helpful staff and a nice and quite atmosphere. The rooms are beautifully decorated, impeccably furnished and maintained. The breakfast is included in the rate and is excellent, with a great selection of cakes, croissants etc.Also, the hotel has a nice restaurant I Chiostri. We had dinner there and we tried some great food at a very reasonable price for a 4 star hotel.So, do not hesitate to book this hotel and have a memorable stay!!
Reviews.Author: sg79losangeles

Reviews.Content: Loved the Grand Hotel Minerva       View from the roop terrace
Reviews.Author: Helena-CuteKat

Reviews.Content: lovely hotel deserves lovelier setting My wife and I spent a wonderful weekend in this splendid hotel. Only 10/15 minutes walk from the station it offers easy access to all the sights.The hotel itself was very comfortable, the standard of decor, cleanliness, accommodation excellent and the staff first class. There is a lovely breakfast room and the roof terrace is a great place to escape to after a hard day sightseeing.Our room was one of the best we have had in Italy and although we were at first disappointed at not overlooking piazza (it overlooked church cloisters) it turned out to be a godsend as the square was very shabby. At night it seemed to be a gathering place for some shifty characters as the abundance of empty wine and beer bottles in the morning would testify. To be fair, we saw no trouble and I understand renovations are ongoing which can only be good for the Minerva.Florence, of course, is stunning. Take the tourist bus for an overview of all the sights and also take the second route where you climb up into the hills above the city. The vista is superb.As you would expect, good restaurants abound but, for a perfect pizza, Descartes, round the corner from Santa Novella is a must.One major moan - we used the Terravision shuttle bus from and to Pisa airport. Suffice to say a complete and utter stressful shambles would be an understatement. Next time we shall take the train.John McLBothwell, Scotland
Reviews.Author: johnmcl

Reviews.Content: Nice hotel, neighborhood under renovation This hotel is near the train station and to the Santa Maria Novella church -- which is supposed to have a gorgeous facade. Unfortunately, the whole piazza there is under renovation (it needs it) and most of the buildings were covered by construction materials. We couldn't even see the facade of the church. The hotel itself is a very nice oasis in this midst of this chaos, so while we didn't enjoy the surroundings, we did enjoy the hotel. We also were really lucky because they upgraded us to a suite on the top floor where we literally could sit on our bed and take pictures of the Duomo. That part was amazing! Coming from Rome where our room was the size of a shoebox, the Minerva was great! HUGE room, jacuzzi tub, shower, dual sinks, separate sitting room and bedroom areas. Quite luxurious. We also enjoyed the rooftop bar and it's views of Florence. From the rooftop you can't see the construction, only the vistas. The food was very good, particularly the breakfast. Great variety of food choices. No U.S.-style orange juice though. Very accessible to all the sites of Florence...the Duomo, Uffizi, Galleria D'Accademia (David). Best restaurant by far is only a couple blocks away...Il Latini -- well worth the wait!
Reviews.Author: dclawbabe

Reviews.Content: Highly recommend We stayed in the Minerva twice in summer 2006. This is an elegant downtown hotel just a few minutes walk from the train station and the Duomo. The food is good and the staff pleasant. As It's one of the few hotels in Florence with a pool, this made it especially attractive to our extended family which included five children under seven. The views from this rooftop pool and nearby bar/restaurant are world class. Rooms vary a lot in size and quality of view. While famous, the Piazza Santa Maria Novella on which the hotel stands, can be somewhat scruffy late at night and is currently undergoing a major renovation, as is its church, whose facade will be invisible for some time.
Reviews.Author: dublintraveller100

Reviews.Content: Ordinary Italian Genius In Italy things either work magically - incredible architecture, sunsets, food, street life, etc - or they're just broken - train delays, torched no smoking signs, illogical servicing policies, etc - all of it tied to the magic of synchronicity and mood. This hotel fell 97% into the magic mode. They do use the pool as a corporate tool and if your lounging schedule mixes with their party booking roster your poolside snoozes are toast. For us that was the 2%.However, our room - even though buried in the bottom of the interior courtyard - was wonderful. The hotel's almost 50 year old renovation was textbook modern even with the photomurals.The view from the pool was incredible. (Brunelleschi's dome seen through a beer bottle anyone? Or the hills of Florence at sunset framed between two rose bottles? Nothing much finer really...) And the service was inspired. Breakfasts were incredible and the only other 1% glitch was the morning pot of coffee tasting like instant. We survived.As for the rough nature of the piazza out front go smell the grass...That's right...grass, alive and living in the centre of Florence. It's not golf course perfect, but it's the only place for blocks around where nature isn't potted, so it's hardly a surprise for a wide variety of people to come by and enjoy. Amazing what you'll see when you travel...
Reviews.Author: Spragoo

Reviews.Content: What a room - what a view! We were upgraded to the balcony suite on the first floor (room 107) which I can strongly recommend, if only for the amazing fresco on the ceiling!This is a wonderful hotel, convenient for every part of Florence, and the staff are very anxious to tell you that the Piazza outside in currently undergoing restoration (as is Santa Maria Novella next door) following complaints from visitors about noise and concerns about safety. Plenty of carabinieri in evidence at night, but it wasn't necessary as everyone was really pleasant.Breakfast was a huge buffet, served from 7am which was really helpful for getting to Pisa airport.Would definitely stay here again.
Reviews.Author: janeyscott

Reviews.Content: Very happy with this hotel - and what a great pool!       hotel
Reviews.Author: charliesmum

Reviews.Content: Very disappointed. My husband and I stayed in the GHM for 3 night on our honeymoon in June/July and I have to say we were very disappointed.The main reason we chose this hotel was because it had a rooftop pool and terrace - somewhere to chill out after a hot days sightseeing, such a shame we didn't really get to use it......The second day we were there there were posters up saying there was a party for guests at the pool that evening, however you had to pay to go up there (I think it was around 15 Euros), we had already decided after paying 310 Euros per night for our room, which included use of the pool, there was no way we were going to pay again to use the pool to go to some party which we didn't even want to go to.So, already annoyed that we wouldn't be able to use the pool or even enter the rooftop terrace or bar that evening (if you didn't pay you weren't even allowed up the stairs)! We decided to finish our siteseeing early and spend some time relaxing by the pool. When we got up to the pool, mid afternoon, there were half the sunbeds that were there normally and they were all taken, when we asked where they were we were told they had been moved so that they could set up for the party that night. My husband said this was unacceptable and that we wanted some sunbeds brought back up as the party was not starting for a good few hours, the staff said they couldn't do this so my husband went down to reception and after a long argument with the rude reception staff they agreed to bring up some sunbeds. We waited almost half an hour and in the end some people left the pool area so we took their loungers.The next day we saw that some new posters had been put up stating the pool would be closed tonight as there was a Private party. We were out on a tour all day so as soon as we got back we went for a swim and then relaxed on the loungers in the early evening sun looking over the city, it was beautiful, we decided we would lay there and watch the sun go down with a bottle of wine, and then as we were nodding off over came the staff telling us we had to move as they needed to set up for the Private Party, we refused saying that we had paid for a hotel with a pool and this was the second eve we couldn't use it. In the end we had to move- this completely ruined our evening and we had to go back to our room (which had no balcony to sit out on)!I went down to reception and said that I was very annoyed that we hadn't been able to use the pool 2 out of 3 nights we were there, but unfortunately there was no one there to listen to my complaint and I had to go back to see the Reception Manager in the morning.He was extremely rude saying that guests paid for the room and breakfast only and that the pool was basically just a bonus! I told him that if this was the case they should not show the pool as one of the facilities on the website. After a very long, heated discussion and he eventually gave us a discount our room, but this was not the point, we booked this hotel mainly because of the pool and didn't really get to use it, we would rather have had no discount and been able to use the facilities advertised. The staff were rude and we didn't appreciate having to row with them on our honeymoon.
Reviews.Author: SG1

Reviews.Content: La Magnifico Minerva! We stayed at the Minerva for 3 nights on honeymoon in a spacious well appointed suite overlooking the cloisters of SMN Church. Staff were attentive and helpful - it helps if you at least attempt to communicate in Italian although most speak perfectly good English. The whole place is tastefully furnished with a good buffet breakfast (the best out of the three we stayed in)Locally around the hotel the square which other reviewers have referred to is lively at night time but not in the slightest bit threatening - just people gathering to socialise with friends and talk... Il Grillo opposite was the best dinner we had in Florence during our stay, followed by Il Grotto di Leo Pizzeria down via della Scala. There is also an excellent gelaterie in the square. The hotel is within easy walking distance of all of Florences attractions and for going further afield SMN Train and Bus station is literally round the corner.Minuses - downstairs American Bar wasnt open - but this might have been due to staff holidays/shortages as our stay was in Ferrogosto week! Upstairs pool bar was expensive but the location made up for it. It does advertise itself as a family hotel - but the pool area did seem to be overrun with noisy children both times we were there, one of which was late in the evening. The scaffolding and building works do spoil the view of Il Duomo and SMN Church - but thats not the fault of the hotel!We thoroughly enjoyed our stay and would happily stay there again!
Reviews.Author: Peteimus

Reviews.Content: Very nice Hotel was nice, room was spacious and clean. Staff were very helpful and friendly. Everything is local adn within walking distance. Where the hotel is situated the area was being renovated so wasn't very pictureesque. Train station is a stones throw away. Would go back again.
Reviews.Author: Jashpal

Reviews.Content: Very disappointed I chose this hotel because I was traveling alone with my teenage daughter and wanted a pool to cool off in after touring Florence. The pool was the only positive thing about this hotel. The location is convenient to the train station but the hotel faces a square that is basically a field of dirt circling a fountain. It is by far the ugliest site in Florence. The square is generally filled with people that do not look like most of the other people we saw in Florence and could be quite frightening at times. I have spent a lot of time in Manhattan and am exposed to all types of people on a regular basis, but this was very disturbing. The front desk was not very helpful and could be rude at times. The room was tiny as expected but with no view. After asking for a room with a view, we were given the room directly under the pool. It had a wonderful view of the Duomo (but also of the ugly plaza), but was very noisy. We switched back to the original room and finally settled in but were left with the feeling that we were too much trouble for the hotel. The roof top pool area is small but lovely and almost makes up for all the negatives. Overall, I would not stay here again.
Reviews.Author: elligirl

Reviews.Content: To Warm to Handle My family was a little disappointed when we stayed in this hotel. The decor was not 5 star and airconditioning was not working well and staff would not assist in lowering or suggest changing rooms. We were glad when the tour moved on to Rome....
Reviews.Author: kimv3020

Reviews.Content: Church Is Under Renovation       Church under renovation
Reviews.Author: HJR75

Reviews.Content: Absolutely love the Minerva!!! My husband and I stayed at this hotel while on our honeymoon last June. We loved it!! We definately would have to say that this was the best part of our trip. The hotel is beautiful, the breakfast is plentiful, and the rooftop swimming pool is an added treat, especially when you go in the heat of summer. As far as closeness is concerned, we had to problem getting around, although perhaps if you wanted something within a 5 minute walk, you should look elsewhere. Its close enough to walk everywhere, at least that's what we found. A few interesting notes, though.... As far as the so-called rif-raft that can be found outside in the piazza - we had no issues at all. There were oftentime groups of people gathered, but we never felt unsafe of in harms way. Perhaps it was because my husband was there, I can't be sure! Another point - the front desk staff. Overall we found them okay, but not overly helpful. Luckily we spoke Italian and made our way around just fine. Overall, we would definately return to this hotel!!!!
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member

Reviews.Content: Really friendly fast service As a single women business traveller, I am always a bit weary on where I stay. Yes, I have to be honest outside the hotel does give the chills, as there are a lot of various nationalities sitting around. The hotel definitely makes up for it, I got an immediate upgrade to a suite room which is really nice, with a fantastic view. Reception were quick and efficient on check inThe pool is great and been alone is a great way to spend a few hours in the evening in Florence. (in summer) Would definitely stay here again.
Reviews.Author: Minetta

Reviews.Content: Beware of thieves Do not stay here - it is very dangerous! We just returned from staying in this hotel, where two ladies in our tour group were robbed while they were asleep in their room. Their passports, wallets and jewelry were all stolen. The police told the ladies they're lucky they didn't wake up or they'd probably have been killed. We had been concerned about all the riff-raff hanging about outside the hotel, and with good reason. The hotel needs to tighten up their security in a big way.
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member

Reviews.Content: Great location  The square in front of the hotel is one of the few places in Florence where there is a large grassy area and where people can congregate in the evening to talk, sing, drink and just relax as the sun goes down. If you have travelled in other latin countries this is par for the course and really isn't threatenening at all. It is admittedly quite a cosmopolitain mix but I think the reactions by some of the reviewers here is more to do with their own anxiety at coming into contact with people from different cultures than a real threat. If you want antisceptic tourism then there is always CenterParcs and Club Med.This is really great hotel perfectly placed for all the sites in Florence. Sitting in the hotel pool at 10.30pm and being able to overlook Il Duomo is pretty special and at the prices we paid for the rooms was great value.Hotel is also air conditioned which was perfect given the 37 degrees outside.
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member

Reviews.Content: Excellent Really great place. It is full of the standard loud US people on their European tour but I am not sure how you avoid that in 4 star hotels in tourist Italy. The pool area is just what it should be, the room was clean, tasteful and large, the service was impeccable. The room had a great view of the cloisters of Santa Maria Novella, red-tiles and little birds flying all over them in the morning. I wanted to hug the whole place.Walked across the square late at night and the scariest it got was when the guy selling water at a little stall didn't have enough change for a 20 E note (he was the scared one I think) . My guess is that the Italian police have moved the druggies somewhere where they don't upset us tourists.
Reviews.Author: Tony221268

Reviews.Content: NOT worth it Okay I agree with the reports that people say about this hotel the rooms are very nice and the breakfast was fine (although I had better in italy and it wasn't that great) but ...1. The location is terrible -- it was right by the train station and the church that you see in all the pictures was under construction as well as the rest of the square...although you could walk a few blocks and it was much better it still was not a good location in my book. Although we could walk places, there are better locations than this one2. The staff was rude -- when asking about day trip one staff member kept on not listening to us and asking if we wanted a car, when we were asking about the trains...he also was very helpful about picking restaurants. The one place he told us where to go, he did make a reservation for us (when he said he did) and it was CLEARLY only tourists who go there...i don't know about you but when i go to places I ike to eat where the locals go...it was by FAR THE WORST MEAL we had in Florence. ALso when we want directions to a restaurant we picked, he just drew a line a map and said we will find it I would not recomend this hotel, especially for the money...I would say pick the another hotel even if you may need spend a few more dollars a night
Reviews.Author: dbk2101

Reviews.Content: Grand Hotel Minerva We just returned from staying at the Grand Hotel Minerva in Florence, Italy. Although the Hotel was fine (clean, rooms were large, etc), the neigborhood is terrible and I would never stay there again. It is located in the Santa Maria Novella Piazza and there alot of people loitering and drinking right in front of the Hotel. We did not feel safe going out after dark because of the gangs that would be at the Piazza. We were actually followed one night by one of these gangs and we had to return to the Hotel to eat dinner and never went out again after dark. I hope this helps others considering staying there.
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member

Reviews.Content: Excellent Hotel, Excellent Location We spent from Christmas Eve until New Year's Day at this wonderful hotel. We could not have asked for a better place. The room (family suite with 2 bedrooms and 2 baths) was perfect for our family of 4. It was spacious and very clean. We especially liked the tea, hot chocolate and cookies that were complimentary, coming back to the room after a long day of seeing Florence in the snow! The hotel is in a perfect location - all the sites are within easy walking distance and the bus and train stations are within close proximity for venturing outside of Florence. The breakfast buffet was delicious - a great way to start your morning. The staff was friendly and very helpful, always ready to help you with dinner reservations or tours that you might like to take. The roof top terrace was an amazing place to see the fireworks on New Year's eve - 360 degree splendor. And the bells on Christmas Eve are something you will never forget! We would go back to Florence and stay is this hotel a minute - hopefully someday!
Reviews.Author: TravelingwithFamily

Reviews.Content: Just brilliant We stayed at this hotel for 3 nights in May and it wasn't long enough. We had booked superior rooms as we had children with us and wanted plenty of space. Our room was one of the best I have ever stayed in with a lovely 4 poster bed, a dressing room and a bathroom that was almost as big as the bedroom.The staff were fine and breakfast was great. My favourite feature, though, are the little public roof terraces on each floor - fabulous for spending your evenings (or days!) overlooking Florence in the sunshine with a drink!
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member

Reviews.Content: Great Location We walked to the hotel from Santa Maria Novella Train Station, but made the mistake of going right instead of left so ended up going the long way. Another plus about the location was is was just metres from where we caught the bus for various tours booked through Affi Tours.Our twin room was bright and spacious with very nice bathroom. I think the room was too comfortable as my daughter did not want to leave it. This was the only Italian Hotel which supplied a kettle. Walls were thin and unfortunately had inconsiderate neighbours who arrived back late, were drunk and loud. Was kept awake by guy snoring which could also be heard from the hallway.Hotel supplied computer with free internet use which was fantastic. Breakfast was superb with offerings of bacon, eggs (suspect), cold meats, pastries, fresh fruit, juices etc. Hotel also had bikes for hire at about 鈧? per half day but didn鈥檛 have the courage to cycle around Florence. This was an exceptional hotel, pity I couldn't warm to the front desk personnel.Tip: Get a good map before exploring Florence!!
Reviews.Author: shirley_123

Reviews.Content: Funky and Cool! We stayed at the Minerve as part of a tour of Italy. The location is absolutely outstanding--you can easily walk to all the best parts of Florence. Plus, you are in a lovely piazza and the rooftop pool/terrace affords the most unbelievable 360 degree views of Florence. The rooms are kind of funky, with darkly polished hardwood floors--but they are well appointed, large (by European standards) and very clean. After staying at a very fancy (old-world) hotel in Rome, this was fun and different--very nice. Breakfast buffet was wonderful, staff pleasant.
Reviews.Author: cocoajean

Reviews.Content: Highly recomended Really good hotel (Staff, rooms, cleanliness,...), well located near the main monuments and in a quiet environment.Only one recommendation: ask for a room in the highest floor.
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member

Reviews.Content: Very Satisfied with The Minerva We spent 3 nights March 12-15 at the Minerva. I wanted a hotel close to the train station, and had booked the room using the hotel's website several months in advance. About 3 weeks before departure I went back to the website and was able to change the reservation to a superior room for 15 Euro per night less than the original standard room web price, so check their price offerings. The room was unusually large for a European hotel, contemporary furniture and light colours, facing the piazza and cathedral, with a four-poster bed, a sitting area, separate dressing area and a huge marble bath with two sinks, whirlpool tub and separate shower. Breakfast had a good selection. There was complimentary bottled water and cookies in the room. Front desk and restaurant staff were cheerful. All the sites were within 10 mins walk. We found the piazza in front of the hotel very safe and not at all intimidating, so don't worry. We could not have been happier and would definitely return.
Reviews.Author: foulaman

Reviews.Content: Very happy with Grand Hotel Minerva Was pleasantly surprised with this hotel- great location if you are traveling by train. Its right near the station and within walking distance to everything you want to see or do in Florence. The staff was very helpful and the rooftop pool and bar is fantastic. Definitely have some cocktails up there in the evening while the sun is setting over the Duomo. I thought this was great value for the money. Rooms were clean. My only warning is to beware of some of the shady characters (pickpocketers?) hanging around outside in the piazza.
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member

Reviews.Content: Loved the location! This hotel was a great find- thanks to Tripadvisor:) I was also able to fly into florence and take a bus from the airport to the train station for only a few Euro's (which I also learned from this site) Once I got to the train station I only had to walk across the square and to our hotel. THe hotel was clean and the rooms were a decent size. Our windows did open up to the square, and late at night there was some noice (but we were so tired- we usually just hit the bed and feel asleep). They also had a nice breakfast with lots of fruit  juices, etc. I was so happy with this hotel.
Reviews.Author: jerseyjenn

Reviews.Content: Good hotel We booked a package through Expedia, then emailed hotel later and asked for an upgrade as others had suggested. For 100 Euro/day more, we got a suite on the top floor, and it was well worth it. Suite was very large, with a great view of the square. Did not notice noise at night on square as others suggested. You can close the shutters on the very large windows to help keep out noise. Breakfast was very good, real eggs and sausage. Bartender Siad, from Morocco, was very accomodating, nice fellow. Most of the other staff were very good and friendly, but the desk clerk at night had NO personality, and screwed up our bill to the tune of 600 Euro. We were in a hurry to get to the airport, no time to argue, and eventually hotel wired the refund to me. No problem with that, just took time. The location of the hotel is not all that great, it is a decent walk to the main sights. As we went in November, no swimming in the pool. Went up there, it does have a great view of the city, but pool is small. Hotel staff can pre-book tours of the Academia and Uffizi, which was helpful. My only piece of construtive criticism was Wi-Fi is available around the bar area, it should not be too difficult to make it available in the rooms. But then we would not have gotten so acquainted with Siad the bartender.
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member

Reviews.Content: Great!!!! One of the best hotels i have ever stayed in! The room was huge, had a great view of the hills from the bathroom and the square out the front! The room even had a dressing room! The room was super clean, aircon worked, had cool wooden floor and superb view. It was such a delight to swing open the shutters in the morning and have the view! Only problem would be the stupid street cleaning machine outside decided to clean the square at 2 in the morning!!!!!!!!!! it was soo loud. The pool on the roof is simply incredible and the views are also outstanding! The hotel was modern and yet had the italian character that i like. Highly recommend it. Also the train station is really close.
Reviews.Author: HighStandards

Reviews.Content: This place is a must if you love Florence       Take one of the great horse-drawn carriages around the town. Great way to get around.
Reviews.Author: Londontraveller1301

Reviews.Content: Just perfect! This was my first trip abroad and what a wonderful hotel to stay in!The staff were extremely helpful from my initial enquiry and nothing was a problem. Arranging tickets and booking restaurants for us.Highly recommend the Grand Hotel Minerva and I'll be back!
Reviews.Author: Pigfish

Reviews.Content: Grand Hotel Minerva lives up to reputation Grand Hotel Minerva great access to Train and downtown Florence.Opted for deluxe and it is virtually a suite. Bathrooms are clean and functional with high tech whirlpool in one that somewhat confused.Breakfast buffet was tastefull and presented in a classy manner.The square in front takes on some seedy aspects after dark but not a big problem. This is after all an urban area and some aspects add to the fascination of Florence.Cold roof top pool. Ugh.Free internet station if you can get to it. Desk staff a bit stuffy but no big deal. This is a beautiful hotel and good value for the class/amenities.
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member

Reviews.Content: A Gem of a Hotel in a Jewel of a city We have just returned from a wonderful holiday at the end of August and part of the reason we had such a great time was the Grand Minerva Hotel.Florence is a beautiful city and the Hotel is situated around five minutes walk from the Duomo. Whilst there has been a great deal of talk about rather dubious groups and indivduals that congregate around the Piazza at night, it is far from threatening and seemed to be mainly families and friends chatting together. We had a classic double room, which was very clean and spacious (cleaned thoroghly every day including fresh linen). We loved the wooden floors and the marble bathroom, and I especially enjoyed the fact that there was a speaker in the loo so you could listen to MTV whilst having a shave! When it comes to roof top terraces, this has to be the best in Florence. We climbed the Campanile and could see all of the roofs over Florence, this was the only hotel with a pool and stood out from all of the rest! It was fantastic to sit in the summer sun and enjoy a drink around the pool, where Sahid the bar man was very welcoming and friendly - or better still, get up to watch the sunrise over Florence, we know it was early, but we were so glad we did, a view like no other! The breakfasts were wonderful and had a superb selection ranging from eggs and bacon to pastries and cereal, likewise the breakfast staff were always happy and welcoming.Overall this is a fantastic place to stay, in one of the most beautiful cities in the world, it is true to say that the reception staff need to go on a puplic relations course at times (the female staff were really nice, but the guys were just plain rude!). A Gem of a Hotel in a Jewel of a city, we would certainly return to this hotel, we might keep our times at reception to a minimum, but the room, terrace, food and overall standards make your stay special.
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member

Reviews.Content: The Minerva is magical!!! We just LOVED the Grand Hotel Minerva!! We stayed there for 4 nights at the end of August 2005. We travel with our 3 daughters and it's always hard to find a hotel in Europe with a family room that fits 5. Grand Hotel Minerva has a fabulous family room. It is 2 levels with 2 bathrooms and has so much room you can't believe it! The king bed is on the main floor and there is a bedroom upstairs with 2 twin beds and then an alcove with one more additional bed. We paid 300 Euros per night which included tax and breakfast for all 5 of us. I think it's 400 Euros during the on season. We paid less because the end of August is considered off seaon. The weather in August was so much better than we expected. I thought it was going to be so hot and humid, but it was warm - in the 80's - and very pleasant. I booked this hotel not only for the family room, but for the wonderful rooftop pool. The water was too cold for me to go in, but my kids loved it. The views from the top of the hotel were amazing. We woke up one morning to view the sunrise from there and I will always remember the beauty! The breakfast buffet was outstanding! Such a variety and everything was delicious and fresh. There is a computer for the guests to use where you can go on the internet for free. I can't think of one negative about this hotel. The square out front had a lot of people in it at night, but they were not threatening at all. There was no noise problem either. I highly recommend this hotel. If you go to Florence - don't miss eating in Il Latini or La Giostra - both fabulous restaurants! If you need a pharmacy - the pharmacy across the square had the NICEST english speaking pharmacist who was very helpul!
Reviews.Author: sleep7

Reviews.Content: Cocktails at sundown I had reserved a twin room with my mum for 3 nights over the hotel's own website. We were so looking forward to going after looking at the pictures, etc. When we arrived at the hotel we were told that there was a problem with our booking and that their reservations department had made a mistake and not entered our booking onto their system - despite us having confirmation from them! To say we were unhappy was an understatement! They offered to book us into the Santa Maria Novella Hotel just across the piazza, which was lovely, but very empty and no rooftop pool and terrace. Despite this, we did manage to stay in the Grand Hotel Minerva on the 2 other nights and although our room didn't have a great view, the rooftop terrace certainly made up for it! This was one of the other resons that we booked the hotel. The view from here is lovely (although there are a few cranes in sight) and we had drinks in the evening overlooking the city.We also ate in the hotels restaurant on the second night and the food was amazing! I had chefs taster selection - 4 courses (2 small plates in each) with wine to complement each course for 45E. My mum had the best duck risotto I have ever tasted and the service was second to none. The service however, wasn't always quite so good on reception. A few of the staff seemed to look down their noses at us and weren't very helpful/polite at all.Although I had read reviews saying that people felt uncomfortable in the piazza at night, we had no problems at all - it just seemed to be friends chatting.I would recommend this hotel for the location (easy to walk to all sights), rooftop terrace and food, but I would say check your reservation with the hotel before you leave! This is why I have only given the hotel an average score.
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member

Reviews.Content: Amazing hotel Earlier this month we enjoyed a wonderful 7 night stay at the Grand Hotel Minerva. The staff were very friendly and helpful and our room was extremely luxurious with solid wood furniture and marble bathroom. Some reviews we had read on tripadvisor prior to out trip made us feel a little uneasy about the piazza at night. However we were pleased to discover that the atmosphere was not threatening at all and the majority of the people in the piazza were familys and tourists. Our favourite aspect of the hotel was definitely the roof top terrace. The views are beautiful and we spent many a happy and restful afternoon relaxing by the pool after seeing the sights of Florence. We would definitely recommed this hotel!
Reviews.Author: k_killough

Reviews.Content: Less than Grand This is the first time tripadvisor[-] hotel reviews have let me down. I do not understand the rave reviews of this hotel. Despite reserving a room 7 months prior to our visit, we were given a room in need of rennovating. It looked out on garbage caught on tiled roof-tops. The very old carpet in our non-smoking room had cigarette burns. The ceiling was badly damaged and peeling. The curtains were falling off, (too high up to fix), and the black-out curtain liner had bare spots where sun shone through since the black-out vinyl had peeled off. Upon arrival to our room it began to pour; the rain came into the room soaking the wall and carpet. When I phoned the desk to request a different room, the receptionist said someone would come to check on it and that there were no other rooms. Although someone did come, there was nothing he could do since the windows simply did not seal shut. The bed pillows were the equivalent of sandbags. In pre-dawn hours each night I heard the noise of furniture being dragged endlessly across a floor, perhaps the rooftop furniture since we were on top floor. Yes, the piazza is a down-trodden disaster. There was nothing grand about this hotel. The hotel's photos were very misleading. Over-rated, over-priced.
Reviews.Author: Jerecita

Reviews.Content: Beautiful hotel, unprofessional staff. Although this is a lovely hotel the staff at reception were so unhelpful. We really expected better from a Summit hotel. e.g. on hearing that there would be a 24 hr rail strike, we asked the receptionist for advice and information on buses. He said we would have to get a private car to Bolgona at a cost of 鈧?80. When I asked was this the only alternative he insisted it was. Thanks to a very helpful English couple who overheard us we were able to get alternative travel at a cost of 鈧?5 each. Such a pity about the attitude. We also booked a special package. Again like another reviewer we had to tell reception about what was included in the deal. The one positive thing about this hotel is the rooftop pool and views. If you don't mind dealing with ignorance this is one good reason to stay in the Minerva.
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member

Reviews.Content: Great Time! Great place to stay! The staff was great and recommended great restuarants to dine at. The room was clean and the size was large. The breakfast was great and so was the staff. The pool area makes the hotel great. The views are fantastic (except for the various constuction cranes that are everywhere at this time) The pool is not big, small in fact, but after a July day its great to cool off before dinner. I did not give an excellent review for the fact of the plaza out front of the hotel, boring grass and trash. Its not the hotels problem and I hope the city could somehow dress it up.
Reviews.Author: m1mars

Reviews.Content: Not as pleased as last year I have just come back from 3 days at the Minerva but am slightly disappointed. I stayed here last year and I loved it, the service was great, the room was lovely etc. This year it seems as though they might be under new management? For a treat I booked a suite as they had a special summer promotion, but they had no idea what this package included. I had no upgrade, had to ask for all the extras e.g free dinner that I was promised and they seemed not to be bothered. The girl at the pool bar was hardly ever there so no drinks could be ordered, generally the staff's lack of interest ruined my trip. I don't often get the chance to stay in a suite and would not have bothered if this is the level of service you get! It is a good hotel for the money, and the pool is nice but in future I may stay at the JK Place as that looks lovely.Also the A/C was not working well and rooms overlooking the square can be noisy so be careful!
Reviews.Author: danibrown

Reviews.Content: magnificent!! We stayed in grand hotel minerva this july and it was ab-so-lu-te-ly great!the staf was very friendly, the rooms were spacious and clean. (we booked deluxe rooms) the bathrooms were big and very clean. the service was fantastic, rooms cleaned in the morning, tidied up in the afternoon. they served an easy lunch at noon, which was one of our best lunches we had and not to forget, one of the cheapest. the same with a dinner we had there. the chefs interpretation of tuscans kitchen: splendid! the roof top terrace was a nice treat after a day of walking through hot florence. a quick dip before dinner and a late night swim cooled us down. except for one night when a bunch of children were stimulated by their parents to jump and splash as much as they could. arrogant, uneducated, but most of all, very sad. luckily the staff of the hotel came and brought them to a rest so we could enjoy our lovely night with splendid views over florence.
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member

Reviews.Content: Great place - one of the best views of Florence!! Great hotel,...rooms a bit on the small side,...but hotel had everything we needed and service was absolutely wonderful!! Loved the pool and rooftop views!! At night it was spectacular!! highly recommened (we travelled with kids and they loved it too!!!)
Reviews.Author: MamaTrip

Reviews.Content: Amazing roof top views My Fiance and I stayed at the Grand Minerva this June and loved it. The rooms are nice but what made the hotel fantastic was the roof top pool and bar. The views of Tuscany and Florence rival any of the hotels in Florence. The service was also fantastic. The concierge was most helpful and even helped us retreive a lost camera. The park across the street is a bit sketchy but the location of the hotel and roof well made up for that. I would visit again.
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member

Reviews.Content: Wonderful hotel This is a great hotel. We just returned from a long weekend at the Minerva which rates as one of the best hotels I have stayed in. From the reception to the room and bathroom, everything was clean and tidy. Our room was larger than average with high ceilings, large walkin warddrobe and a large marble bathroom. The air conditioning worked very well and was quiet enought to leave on over night. The food in the breakast hall was an excellent variety of fresh bread, fruits, pastries, and local cold meats, plus hot bacon and sausages.The best part of the hotel is definitly the roof top swimming pool and sun terrace. This give fantastic views across the city roof tops and although they don't server breakfast up there, we asked and they were happy to bring a tray up for us. Breakfast looking out across old Florence and the Doumo was fantastic. There is also a bar on the roof and several other smaller terraces. All staff we encountered were professional and friendly.A few people commented on the gathering of undesirables on the square outside at night. Whilst there were a few noisy people gathered early evening (maybe this is beacuse this is one of only a few grassed squares where you can sit down), most had gone by midnight and we never felt unsafe. The double glazing on the windows kept out any noise. The hotel is only a 5 mins walk to most of the main attractions and also only 5 mins from the train and bus station.I highly recommend this hotel to all.
Reviews.Author: stevegos

Reviews.Content: The Magical Minerva - A truly Grand Hotel in Florence The Grand Hotel Minerva is everything I expected it to be and is the most satisfying value for money hotel I have ever been in... It really added to the romance of my trip to Florence and the views of the Florence Sunset from the rooftop bar will stay with me for the rest of my days. The service was exceptional and breakfast was a feast - they had everything including toasted apples! Our room was above average in size (we booked a standard double through the hotel website) and our room rate included breakfast, taxes and service. You can walk to all of the major attractions in Florence making the Grand Hotel Minerva excellent value for money. The hotel guarantees you the best rate if you book through their own website which is grandhotelminerva - I will always return to this hotel when hopefully one day I will go back to Florence.
Reviews.Author: thelittlesthobo

Reviews.Content: What a relief I have just returned from a four night break in Florence, prior to going I was so apprehensive about accomodation I looked at every single hotel in Florence and read their reviews. I decided to opt for this hotel because of the good reviews and I am so glad that I did! My daughter and two nieces are very particular about hotels and they were very impressed with our family suite (with two bathrooms). The staff were excellent and very helpful, the hotel and its standard was one of the best I have experienced.I have no qualms about recommending this hotel and I will most definately be returning next year.
Reviews.Author: yousuf

Reviews.Content: Wonderful stay in Florence We stayed at the Grand Hotel Minerva for six nights in February. The staff was warm and welcoming especially Roberto. The hotel room and bathroom were a nice size and quite comfortable. What impressed me the most was how clean this hotel was.
