I have never stayed in a cleaner hotel and believe me I am quite picky about that. There were alot of nice touches like free internet use (our five-star hotel in Rome didn't have this),a coffee maker with cappucino, hot chocolate, coffee , a variety of teas(our five-star hotel in Rome didn't have this) , candies all around the lobby area (our five-star hotel in Rome didn't have this), a piano in the lobby, all of which made for a welcoming atmosphere. We were visiting our daughter who is studying in Florence, and all of the staff were very friendly to her as well. The breakfast was also very good. It was a buffet with eggs, bacon, sausage, pastries, yogurt, cereal, fresh fruit, coffee, teas and hot chocolate. As far as location , we thought it was great. It was right near everything. It was close to the train station which was very convenient for getting to other areas like Rome, Sienna, Venice , to name a few. I understand being near the train station in Rome is not a good thing but this doesn't seem to be the case in Florence as all of Florence feels safe. I've read reviews were people commented on the undesirable people who hung out in the Piazza outside the hotel. We did not find this to be a problem, however we did go in February and it was rather cold; perhaps in warmer weather this is a problem but I would not let this keep me from enjoying the comforts of this wonderful hotel.I guess everything has at least one negative - there were a couple of annoying noises that we heard when sleeping. One of the noises we figured out when we were at breakfast. You see the hotel including the rooms are not carpeted ( which I personally like) and when the chairs move they make a screaching noise. Our room was right over the restaurant and we heard this noise when people got up and down from their table. The other noise we never figured out. I'm sure we could have gotten our room switched but we had adjoining rooms and there was not another set of adjoining rooms available, so we decided to live with the noise which for all we knew may have been a problem in all of the rooms.Florence is such a beautiful city and if we ever return we would definitely stay at this hotel again.
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member

Reviews.Content: A great hotel! My family and I stayed at this hotel for a week in the Family Suite and found it to be an extremely wonderful hotel. The staff was so helpful and pleasant, and even gave us a discount when they reserved our museum tickets. We were a bit worried about the crowds that other people said to have gathered each night in the square, but we never saw anything even remotely dangerous. The room itself was perfect for what we were looking for, especially since finding a room in Florence to accomodate 4 is particularly difficult). The location was also the perfect distance away from everything. We had a very comfortable walk to all the main attractions, without getting tired out from walking. In all, this is a wonderful hotel and definitely worth staying at.
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member

Reviews.Content: A room with a view in Florence We have just come back from a five day break in Florence and stayed at the Grand Hotel Minerva. We booked a flight and hotel package through the internet and could not specify the type of room we wanted but when I read the reviews on tripadvisor, I got in touch with the hotel directly and was offered various upgrades.   We chose a room with a view of the duomo, overlooking the square and Santa Maria Novella church. The square isn't noisy at all.  It was fantastic and well worth the extra money.   We have stayed all over Italy in a mixture of hotels (five star and below) and this rates as one of the very best. The staff are all extremely helpful, particularly on the front desk. They booked tickets for all the major galleries, which may not have been necessary given that it was low season but an invaluable service once Florence gets really busy.   I imagine the rooftop pool in warmer weather is pretty amazing too.
Reviews.Author: Violet54

Reviews.Content: A very good hotel Stayed for a week in this hotel in December and found it ideal for location. The room was comfortable and clean and it was a very pleasant stay. The staff were helpful and professional. I would highly recommend anyone to choose this hotel. You could not ask for more.
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member

Reviews.Content: Good Choice For Me, What About You? Here is the run down...- If you are travelling by train, great location - it is a 5 minute walk. Do not worry, it isn't too close to the station.- If you dig a rooftop bar, pool, and great view of city, this hotel has that.- If you want a hotel that is in walking distance to everything, this works.- You must be able to ignore the young people that hang about the square in front of the hotel at night. I felt comfortable at night with my girlfriends but if this will ruin it for you - go elsewhere.- Great breakfast, just be assertive with the staff if it is busy!

Reviews.Content: Was almost okay It's perfectly located, just in front of the piazza di S.M.N., very close to the S.M.N. train station and still it's very quiet! We reserved a double room with EUR130,- per night, which faces to nothing but walls. Since the piazza was quiet even during the nights, we wish we could have a room facing the piazza, considering the rate. But the staff were all friendly, the room itself was cozy. We took some pictures at the pool on the top floor of the hotel with S.M.N. church and the famous Duomo on the back. Breakfast restaurant was also with great view of courtyard and variety of food, I have stayed typical Italian 4-star-rated hotels but this was the best. Again the only reason for my rating is the room location for the rate.
Reviews.Author: metyjk

Reviews.Content: The Minerva - Magnificent This is a top notch hotel with some very, very nice touches. The breakfast is absolutely awesome with home made cakes, pastries (still warm) and cooked apples/bananas...? Weird and wonderful I had a great stay and will be back. It is a little expensive but if you book direct you get the best deal - online at grandhotelminerva - incidentally the pub opposite (the fiddler's elbow is great craic)
Reviews.Author: David_Stevens

Reviews.Content: Very nice hotel My husband and I stayed in Grand Hotel Minerva for 2 nights (Nov. 22-24) and we really enjoyed it. Nice hotel, very well-trained staff, good restaurant. Great location - just 5 min. walk from the train station, short walking distance to all the main attractions in the city. I highly recommend this hotel.
Reviews.Author: LenaG

Reviews.Content: Beautiful hotel in a beautiful city I stayed here two nights on a recent trip to Italy. By far, this was the best hotel of the trip. The room was spacious, clean, and updated. The bathroom was nice also. There was a little smell coming up from the drain in the sink. But once you closed the drain, it was undetectable. Our room had a terrace to look out at the piazza. Within a few feet of the hotel there was a great place to get some gelatto, a wonderful bakery, and a beautiful church. I feel the hotel was centrally located enough that you could get to most points of interest with a little walking. Who would not want to walk those beautiful streets?
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member

Reviews.Content: Charming Hotel- Loved it !! In our two week trip to Italy we stayed at several hotels some of them 5 star and other 4 star like the GHM. We must say that we were highly impressed by the GHM for it's ambiance, modern decoration, friendly staff and location. The hotel is nicely decorated, modern and fashionably designed... very nice after a week and a half of staying in old style decorated rooms.Breakfast was wonderful and the concierge exteremly helpful and friendly!!!The only step back would be the image that the plaza gives when arriving to the hotel as it is full of immigrants drinking which does not create a great impression. After walking the plaza several times it does not create any harm but the aspect is not very breathtaking.
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member

Reviews.Content: One of the best of the trip Lovely hotel. Clean, clean room, spacious and full bath with shower. Breakfast with many selections, staff most helpful. Within a block of the train station and several hostels across the piazza. This made for rather large gatherings at night right in front of the hotel with drinking, a few fights and loud music. Our room was not affected but other family disturbed by noise. Would not go out at night without my husband. Close to shopping and the Academy.
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member

Reviews.Content: perfect for what we wanted We stayed at the Minerva from October 6,2004 to October 13th and we found the Minerva perfect for what we needed. It was 2-4 blocks from great shopping. 2 blocks from the San Lorenzo shopping plaza. Several blocks from the Arno. It had all night internet usage for my husband. The front desk was great at booking tours and private guides for us. The rooftop pool was too cold to swim in, and our 8 year old son was disappointed but a lovely spot to rest and get away from the hustle and bustle. The only thing that bothered us was the seediness of the Plaza Santa Maria Novella. We have heard they are raising money to fix it up but it is not pretty to look at. Lots of people milling around and lots of pigeons. I would have preferred to open my windows to a different view. We had my 83 year old mother with us and the elevator came in handy. Taxi's arrived within 2-3 minutes when the front desk called for them. The breakfast in the morning was fine for what we needed to get going.

Sunday seems to be the worst, with garbage strewn all over. It's unfortunate because the hotel itself was nice..but I wouldn't go back until they clean up the area.
